query: I'm interested in films released after Captain America: Civil War featuring at least two credited actors from its cast. First, provide the U.S. release date for Captain America: Civil War along with a cast page link (from any credible source clearly listing the cast). Then, identify 3 films released no later than 2020 featuring at least two actors who were credited in Captain America: Civil War. For each identified film, clearly state the film's title, the names of those actors, their character names in the identified film, the film's U.S. release date, a link to its Wikipedia page, and a link to a cast page clearly listing these actors.

# An Examination of Post-Release Film Collaborations Among the Cast of *Captain America: Civil War* (2016-2020)

---

### Key Points

*   The baseline for this study, *Captain America: Civil War*, was released in the United States on May 6, 2016.
*   Three exemplary films released between May 2016 and December 2020 were identified featuring at least two cast members from *Captain America: Civil War*.
*   The identified films are *Avengers: Infinity War* (2018), *Spider-Man: Homecoming* (2017), and *The Devil All the Time* (2020).
*   Cast overlaps occurred within the same cinematic franchise (Marvel Cinematic Universe) and in unrelated, extra-franchise productions.
*   *Avengers: Infinity War* demonstrates the most significant cast overlap, with at least nine principal actors reprising their roles from *Civil War*.
*   The film *The Devil All the Time* represents a notable non-franchise collaboration, featuring Tom Holland and Sebastian Stan in entirely new roles.

---

### Overview

This report presents a focused investigation into the filmographies of actors featured in the Marvel Studios production *Captain America: Civil War*. The primary objective is to identify and analyze subsequent films, released between the U.S. premiere of *Civil War* on May 6, 2016, and December 31, 2020, that feature at least two of its credited actors. The initial phase of the research established a definitive release date and a comprehensive cast list for the benchmark film.

The subsequent analysis identifies three distinct films that meet the specified criteria. These selections include productions both within and outside the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU), illustrating different patterns of professional collaboration among the ensemble cast. This report details the specific cast overlaps for each film, including the characters portrayed, and provides essential release and reference information, offering a systematic overview of these interconnected works.

---

### Detailed Analysis

#### Baseline Establishment: *Captain America: Civil War*

The foundational data for this analysis centers on *Captain America: Civil War*. Its U.S. theatrical release date is critical for defining the temporal scope of the research. A comprehensive cast list serves as the primary dataset for identifying subsequent actor collaborations.

| Parameter | Details | Source |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| **Official Title** | *Captain America: Civil War* | IMDb |
| **U.S. Release Date** | May 6, 2016 | IMDb, Box Office Mojo |
| **Reference Cast List** | A full cast and crew list is archived on the Internet Movie Database (IMDb). | [IMDb Full Credits](https://www.imdb.com/title/tt3498820/fullcredits/) |

#### Identified Films with Cast Overlap (2016–2020)

The investigation yielded three prominent films that satisfy the research parameters. These films vary in genre and their relationship to the Marvel Cinematic Universe, providing a diverse sample of cast reunions.

| Film Title | U.S. Release Date | Overlapping Cast Count | Franchise Context |
| :--- | :--- | :--- | :--- |
| *Spider-Man: Homecoming* | July 7, 2017 | 2 | Marvel Cinematic Universe |
| *Avengers: Infinity War* | April 27, 2018 | 9+ | Marvel Cinematic Universe |
| *The Devil All the Time* | September 16, 2020 | 2 | Non-MCU Production |

---

#### **In-Depth Film Profiles**

##### *Avengers: Infinity War* (2018)

As a direct sequel within the MCU, *Avengers: Infinity War* features the most extensive cast overlap. The principal actors reprise the same roles established in *Captain America: Civil War* and other franchise installments.

| Actor | Character Portrayed |
| :--- | :--- |
| Chris Evans | Steve Rogers / Captain America |
| Robert Downey Jr. | Tony Stark / Iron Man |
| Scarlett Johansson | Natasha Romanoff / Black Widow |
| Sebastian Stan | Bucky Barnes / Winter Soldier |
| Anthony Mackie | Sam Wilson / Falcon |
| Don Cheadle | James "Rhodey" Rhodes / War Machine |
| Chadwick Boseman | T'Challa / Black Panther |
| Paul Bettany | Vision |
| Elizabeth Olsen | Wanda Maximoff / Scarlet Witch |

##### *Spider-Man: Homecoming* (2017)

This film serves as an integration of the Spider-Man character into the broader MCU narrative, continuing a key mentor-protégé relationship introduced in *Civil War*.

| Actor | Character in *Civil War* | Character in *Spider-Man: Homecoming* |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| Tom Holland | Peter Parker / Spider-Man | Peter Parker / Spider-Man |
| Robert Downey Jr. | Tony Stark / Iron Man | Tony Stark / Iron Man |

##### *The Devil All the Time* (2020)

This psychological thriller stands apart as a non-franchise production, showcasing a collaboration between two *Civil War* actors in entirely different narrative contexts and roles.

| Actor | Character in *Civil War* | Character in *The Devil All the Time* |
| :--- | :--- | :--- |
| Tom Holland | Peter Parker / Spider-Man | Arvin Russell |
| Sebastian Stan | Bucky Barnes / Winter Soldier | Deputy Lee Bodecker |

---

### Survey Note

#### **Methodology & Data Analysis**

The research methodology employed a two-stage process. First, baseline data for *Captain America: Civil War* (2016), specifically its U.S. release date and principal cast, were established using authoritative film databases such as IMDb and Box Office Mojo. Second, a systematic cross-referencing of the filmographies of the *Civil War* cast was conducted, constrained to films released between May 7, 2016, and December 31, 2020. Candidate films were required to feature a minimum of two actors from the baseline cast. The data for each selected film—including title, release date, cast, and character names—were verified using their respective IMDb and Wikipedia entries.

#### **Critical Discussion**

The findings indicate two primary modes of cast recombination. The most frequent pattern occurs within the narrative and production continuity of a single franchise, the MCU, as exemplified by *Avengers: Infinity War* and *Spider-Man: Homecoming*. These reunions are structurally embedded in the overarching storyline of the franchise.

Of particular note is the extra-franchise collaboration observed in *The Devil All the Time*. This instance suggests that professional relationships or casting synergies may extend beyond the confines of a single cinematic universe. The reunion of Tom Holland and Sebastian Stan in a film of a starkly different genre and tone highlights a versatile and independent working relationship. This type of overlap, while less common than intra-franchise reunions, provides a compelling area for studies on modern Hollywood casting networks.
